comments:
I am defining a new project type in a plug-in. My compiler tool has 
cdt.managedbuild.tool.gnu.c.compiler.cygwin.exe.debug as superclass. I want an 
additional boolean option for the compiler which should appear in the pre-
defined category gnu.c.compiler.category.other. See the xml snippet below for 
my definitions.

When I try to create a new managed make project with these settings I get a 
dialog displayed which says "Indexer error" and an expection message in the 
console window:

======================= snippet: error message
Managed Build system manifest file error: Unable to resolve the category 
identifier gnu.c.compiler.category.other in the option 
de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.compiler.option.misc.nocommon.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.internal.core.Tool.getOptions
(Tool.java:707)
...
============================= end: error message

Other approaches which also fail:
- Not to give the new option a category. Same error message plus it's illegal 
according to the documentation.
- Define a new option category for my compiler and assign the new option to 
this category. But I do not want a new category and defining new categories 
leads to the problems I described in bugzilla 86435.
- Subclass the new option from some predefined option (e.g. 
gnu.c.compiler.option.misc.verbose). In this case I have my new option, but it 
replaces the old one. Which is probably correct behavior but still leaves me 
without my _additional_ option :-(


============================= snippet: plugin settings
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?eclipse version="3.0"?>
<plugin id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel" name="Crossdevel Plug-in" 
version="1.0.0" provider-name="">
	<runtime>
		<library name="crossdevel.jar">
			<export name="*"/>
		</library>
	</runtime>
	<requires>
		<import plugin="org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.core"/>
	</requires>
	<extension id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel" name="RMOS-Cygwin-
Crossdevelopment Definitions" 
point="org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.core.buildDefinitions">
		<projectType isAbstract="false" isTest="false" name="RMOS-
Windows-Crossdevelopment Project" id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.projectType">
			<configuration 
id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.rmosemu.debug" name="Emu Debug" 
errorParsers="org.eclipse.cdt.core.MakeErrorParser;org.eclipse.cdt.core.GCCError
Parser;org.eclipse.cdt.core.GASErrorParser" artifactExtension="exe" 
cleanCommand="rm -rf">
				<toolChain osList="win32" name="Tools Emu 
Debug" id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.rmosemu.debug.tools">
					<tool 
superClass="cdt.managedbuild.tool.gnu.c.compiler.cygwin.exe.debug" 
id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.rmosemu.debug.tools.compiler" 
command="/usr/local/bin/i586-rmos-elf-gcc" sources="c,C,cc,CC" outputs="o" 
headerExtensions="h,H" name="GCC C Compiler" outputFlag="-o" 
natureFilter="both">
						<option defaultValue="true" 
isAbstract="false" valueType="boolean" category="gnu.c.compiler.category.other" 
name="No COMMON entries" 
id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.compiler.option.misc.nocommon"/>
					</tool>
					<builder command="make" 
isAbstract="false" name="Make Builder" 
id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.rmosemu.debug.tools.builder"/>
					<targetPlatform isAbstract="false" 
osList="linux" binaryParser="org.eclipse.cdt.core.ELF" name="RMOS Emulator 
Target" id="de.siemens.rmos.crossdevel.rmosemu.debug.tools.target"/>
				</toolChain>
			</configuration>
		</projectType>
	</extension>
</plugin>
============================= end: plugin settings

This bug was fixed in CDT 3.0. (I tested it)
It may be closed.
